questions.question_text: An engineer is upgrading the legacy APs to 802.11ac Wave 2 capable APs. The existing gigabit uplinked switches provide 802.3at. Which switch limitation is a concern?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
802.3at can support up to 30w and for 802.11ac this amount should be enough then A is correct

Selected Answer: A
802.11ac Wave 2 APs can support higher data rates that exceed 1 Gbps, potentially creating a bottleneck at the gigabit Ethernet interface12. This limitation can prevent the APs from achieving their full performance potential. For 802.11ac Wave 2 access points, 802.3at (PoE+) is typically required to ensure full functionality.
I'll go for D as I believe the PoE is something to concern here not the speed. As the switch is already gigabit capable.

choices.A: Set the channel width for 802.11b to 40 MHz and set data rates to 24 MB and Mandatory.
choices.D: Set the channel width for 802.11b to 40 MHz and set data rates to 24 MB and Supported.
choices.C: Set the channel width for 802.11a to 40 MHz and set data rates to 24 MB and Mandatory.
choices.B: Set the channel width for 802.11a to 40 MHz and set data rates to 24 MB and Supported.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The mandatory data rates for 802.11a are 6, 12, and 24 Mbps, with a maximum of 54 Mbps. The typically supported data rates are 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, 48, and 54 Mbps

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
Answer a, supported is wrong, 5ghz better option

questions.question_text: A school deploys a Cisco wireless infrastructure in its classrooms to support a high density of mobile devices. The network administrator wants to bond channels in groups of two and only allow APs to send 802.11 management frames at 24 MB. What should be included in the design to accomplish this objective?

discussion.content:
D is the correct one.
https://support.ekahau.com/hc/en-us/articles/115004974107-Configuring-Active-Surveys

Answer D - "When you perform an ACTIVE site survey to validate the networkâ€™s performance, packet loss or the packet error rate (PER) should be no greater than about 1 percent." Cisco Press Book ENWLSD - Ch5 Applying Wireless Design Requirements - You don't get performance results with a Passive Site Survey, it helps you to discover what its in the wireless network but not the performance of it.

Selected Answer: D
The best way to validate network performance based on the provided alternatives

Selected Answer: D
D is correct for end to end

Selected Answer: C
The question said "Type of Survey" and "Passive" is the only type survey available between the answers
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
Source: https://support.ekahau.com/hc/en-us/articles/115004974107-Configuring-Active-Surveys

The end-to-end network performance testing (Ping) is always made with the wireless network adapter that is currently associated with the network.

Selected Answer: D
Clearly D.
D has to be correct, ping is the only way to test end to end. Spectrum will only indicate issues on the RF portion of the link.

Active Ping Surveys
The end-to-end network performance testing (Ping) is always made with the wireless network adapter that is currently associated with the network. Typically it is the laptop's integrated Wi-Fi network adapter, but you may also use external adapter such as an 802.11ac adapter. Before you start the survey, make sure wireless network adapter is connected to the Wi-Fi network to be able to measure the network performance. 

So D.

"To collect active survey data, you must have an external network adapter collecting passive survey data in addition to the internal NIC for active survey data. For example, Ekahau Sidekick or SA-1 adapter in passive mode in addition to the internal NIC in throughput mode."

Active ping is not used by the engineer but done by the Wireless network adapter. An external analyzer, like SA, should be in Passive Mode for this to happen. Tricky question but the given answer is correct.
Correct answer is D

Spectrum Analysis and Passive Surveys are typically pre-installation surveys (or troubleshooting)
Active ping is a way of active survey. Active survey is a post-installation survey.
In my opinion the answer must be D
Ekahau utilizes spectrum analyzer to perform end-to end wireless and non wireless issues affecting the network. Provided answer is correct.
Answer: C
I think it must be D

questions.question_text: A wireless engineer is using Ekahau Site Survey to validate that an existing wireless network is operating as expected. Which type of survey should be used to identify the end-to-end network performance?

An engineer designed a new wireless network for an enterprise customer. The customer is concerned that some wireless features may not be available because the bill of materials has only Base and no WPlus licenses for the Cisco WLC version 8. What is the reason for the engineer to take this approach regarding the licenses?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/wireless/controller/7.4/configuration/guides/system_management/config_system_management_chapter_011.html

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/wireless/5500-series-wireless-controllers/112926-5508-wlc-license.html

I chose C because of this article although this is specific to the 5508 WLC.

Selected Answer: C
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/7-4/configuration/guides/consolidated/b_cg74_CONSOLIDATED/m_managing_licenses.html

choices.C: All WLC features are available because WPLUS license is now included in the Base license.
choices.D: To have all the features, Plus licenses must be installed on the WLC.
choices.B: CAPWAP Data Encryption licenses are required for this feature.
choices.A: OfficeExtend AP needs a WPlus license.

discussion.content:
Data = low
Voice = medium
Location = hign

comments.content: This is correct. Location Services is the highest number of APs required.

discussion.content:
I wrote wrong comment :
 Data = low
Voice = medium
Location = high

Low - Data
Medium - Location
High - Voice

Low - Data
Medium - Location
High - Voice

A wireless consultant is creating a wireless design for a multistory building. The building will house several groups that will use the wireless network for different operations. Depending on how the wireless network is used, different wireless approach designs must be taken. Drag and drop the services from the left onto the AP density levels on the right based on the wireless deployment requirements.
